subject: Re: [junit] how can make an exception as a true condition
msgSnippet: Hi Timotius, You can do it like this: public void testSetWidth() { MyRectangle rect = new MyRectangle(); Assert.assertNotNull(rect); try { rect.setWidth(-5);
messageBody:
Hi Timotius,

You can do it like this:

public void testSetWidth() {
MyRectangle rect = new MyRectangle();

Assert.assertNotNull(rect);
try {
rect.setWidth(-5);
fail("Should have thrown an IllegalArgumentException");
}
catch(IllegalArgumentException expected) {
//Expected
}
rect.setWidth(4);
Assert.assertEquals(4, rect.getWidth());
}

This way your test will fail if there is no IAE, and if the exception is
thrown as expected the next condition will be tested.

Hope that helps,

John
